Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
So many to choose from, so much to do, all about you. 'Nuff Said.

For people who are passionate about what they want to do. The overarching report of the school may be agriculture, but the professors in all the majors are the best at what they do and have so much to offer that it's great for anyone.
Super Affordable, and a great education to boot.
There are countless organizations and clubs for every interest you have. You can overload your free time joining these and making some amazing friends and mentors in the process
Excellent food service here! Always something delicious and Nutritious to meet your every need.

What a great way to make friends! You are put in with random people that by the end of the first semester you are best friends with. by meeting people of differing interest you can explore who you are and what your interests might be. College is a place to create yourself. Dorm life is like the factory.

The classes are challenging but not in the way you think. They challenge you to achieve more. If you don't understand, the professors are there to help you and there are innumerable resources to help you succeed. NDSU is challenging me to be the best i can be in what I love!
Register early and grab spots in what you love! You will soon discover that the best place to be is among people who understand your passion and drive to pursue YOUR goals. NDSU is that place!
A magnificent institution of higher learning. The professors are always helpful and attentive. It really is the best place to make your career goals into a feasible reality.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {293117=- Have an extremely warm winter coat, hat, gloves, boots, scarves, and long johns. It gets really cold in Fargo with the wind. - Do not let one teacher/professor make you rethink your major. Where there is one bad teacher there are ten great ones. - Join organizations that you find interesting and want to support or start your own organization. - Set an alarm for 7:55 am on Mondays when football tickets go on sale. Make sure you are logged on at 8 am or you may not get a ticket to the game and that is no fun., 328975=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 38261=Food is really good compared to other cafeteria style dining. It has its ups and downs. I don't prefer their asian food, but man is their burger bar the best thing ever. Take advantage of the chocolate milk! And get creative with the grills. There's so much you can make on your own in the dining center! One down side I have is, all the dining centers are closed on the weekend except for The Residence Dining Center. It's a big bummer during the winter. Living in Dinan, I had to get some confidence to make the trek during -40 degrees in January., 221202=March over!!!!!!!!!!}

textAfterTable: Clubs and Activities Tons and tons and tons of clubs/activities. An activity fair is hosted each year, about twice a year just so you can get a real in-depth look at each club and see what you're most interested in. Great for these types of students Friendly, determined, hard-working, happy-go-lucky students. Bang for the buck NDSU is not the costliest of colleges, but you really do get your bang for your buck. It is in a semi-rural area, the professors are very knowledgeable, and the people are just so friendly and welcoming. A great investment for any student. What to do for fun Attend sporting events! (especially Bison football games), join clubs/programs, rollerblade or bike around campus, visit the Wellness Center to either work-out or rock climb or even take part in one of the fitness classes such as Zumba! Food and Dining The dining centers at NDSU offer students with plenty of variety and the menus for each dining center are posted online each day so you can figure out which meal best suits you for the day. Very convenient, not too costly, and the food is definitely good!
